src:
See how West Brom's attendances compare to Leeds United, Nottingham Forest and Championship rivals
West Bromwich Albion latest | The latest attendance figures have been revealed and they show just how the Baggies' attendances compare to Leeds United, Birmingham City and their other 21 Championship rivals.
01 Nov 2019, 20:40 by Jamie Kemble, Mark Wakefield
How do West Bromwich Albion's attendances compare to their Championship rivals?
Over the course of the season we will keep you up to date with the average gates at The Hawthorns, Baggies' best and worst attendances of the campaign and where they rank against second tier foes such as Leeds United, Nottingham Forest and Birmingham City.
How does West Brom's highest attendance and overall average compare with the rest of the Championship? Here are the current figures tables.
AVERAGE ATTENDANCES
1 Leeds United 35,085
2 Nottingham Forest 27,757
3 Derby County 26,652
4 Sheffield Wednesday 24,414

5 West Bromwich Albion 23,722



(Image: PA)


 

6 Stoke City 23,096
7 Cardiff City 22,698
8 Huddersfield Town 22,001
9 Bristol City 21,918
10 Birmingham City 20,484
11 Middlesbrough 19,820
12 Charlton Athletic 18,218
13 Fulham 18,038
14 Swansea City 16,770
15 Reading 15,703
16 Preston North End 14,653
17 Millwall 14,475
18 Barnsley 13,846
 
19 Queens Park Rangers 13,772
20 Blackburn Rovers 13,565
21 Wigan Athletic 11,515
22 Hull City 11,419
23 Brentford 11,262
24 Luton Town 10,058
West Brom latest
This is your round up of all things West Brom; the one-stop shop that will keep you updated on the latest goings on at the club and beyond.
Transfers, injuries, match-days and managers, we’ve got you covered.
We’ll be bringing the very latest on the Baggies throughout the week and around the clock.
Make sure you keep yourself updated with our handy daily catch up...



 
Must reads...

'That close' - Slaven Bilic reveals some brilliant West Brom news 
Leeds boss Marcelo Bielsa has said this about West Brom - and Slaven Bilic will love it 
The players who could leave West Brom in the January transfer window 
This is what Dwight Gayle told Newcastle over West Brom transfer - reports 


For all your latest WBA news, opinion, analysis and transfer gossip, click here

You can follow our West Brom reporter Joseph Chapman on Twitter, and his email address is Joseph.Chapman@reachplc.com
 
HIGHEST ATTENDANCES
1 Leeds United 35,731
2 Nottingham Forest 29,202
3 Derby County 28,454
4 Sheffield Wednesday 28,028

5 West Bromwich Albion 25,356

6 Cardiff City 24,724
7 Stoke City 24,090
8 Bristol City 23,553
9 Huddersfield Town 22,839
10 Middlesbrough 22,075
11 Birmingham City 21,808
12 Charlton Athletic 21,808
13 Swansea City 20,270
14 Preston North End 19,165
15 Fulham 18,654
16 Barnsley 17,598
17 Reading 16,906
18 Millwall 16,808



19 Hull City 16,326
20 Queens Park Rangers 16,186
21 Blackburn Rovers 15,319
22 Wigan Athletic 14,819
23 Brentford 11,870
24 Luton Town 10,066
poll loading
Where will West Bromwich Albion finish in the 2019-20 season?
21000+ VOTES SO FAR
Champions Runners-up Play-offs - promoted Play-offs - not promoted 7-12th 13-21 Relegated  
ALBION’S HOME ATTENDANCES
Millwall 24,305
Reading 21,803
Blackburn Rovers 23,792
Huddersfield Town 23,577
Barnsley 22,086
Charlton 25,356


For all your latest Albion news, opinion, analysis and transfer gossip, click here


LAST SEASON
The Baggies averaged 24,198 in 2018/2019 - which placed them 9th in the Championship, behind Leeds United, Aston Villa, Nottingham Forest, Derby, Stoke, Norwich and both Sheffield clubs.
CAPACITY
The Hawthorns has a capacity of 26,688 according to the club website. They came closest to filling it last season against Sheffield Wednesday on 29 December when 26,548 watched a 1-1 draw.
The lowest was when Swansea came in March 2019, when their 3-0 win was played out in front of just 20,282.
